You are a king, a killer by trade,
A king alone, with Pupphavatī;
You asked the brahmin,
The foolish family priest Khaṇḍahāla.

You are a brahmin skilled in the Dhamma and discipline;
How do people go from here to a good destination,
Having made merit?”

And having killed the innocent, O god;
Thus people go to a good destination,
Having made merit.”
“But what is that excessive gift,
And who are the innocent in this world?
And tell us this,
I will sacrifice, I will give gifts.”
“You should sacrifice with your children, O god,
With your chief queens and with your villages;
With four bulls, four cows, and four heifers,
